preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

The action does not specify a particular user involved, as it appears to be an automated process.

The action involves handling sensitive information related to a digital loan application system, including personal identifiers like Aadhaar and PAN. There is a risk associated with data privacy and security, especially if the data is not handled with appropriate access controls and encryption.

- Recommendations:  
  1. Ensure that all data handling complies with relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, local privacy laws).
  2. Implement robust access control measures to restrict data access to authorized personnel only.
  3. Use encryption for storing and transmitting sensitive data to prevent unauthorized access.

The action does not provide a specific timestamp, but it is assumed to be executed at the time of the request.

Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules.

Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025

 Go-Live: 1 July 2025

 Appendices

preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

summarize_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks

Project Title: Digital Loan Application and Approval System

Key Points:
1. XYZ Bank aims to digitize its loan application process due to increased turnaround time, frequent errors and poor customer experience.
2. An online platform is to be built which includes functions such as application, eligibility assessment, KYC document upload, application status tracking and digital approval.
3. This platform will not assist with home loans, car loans, or business loans and will not offer agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.
4. Key stakeholders include a Product Manager, Business Head – Retail Lending, IT Manager, and a Compliance Lead.

Actions:

2. Begin application development on 1 April 2025.
3. Undergo user acceptance testing (UAT) by 1 June 2025.
4. Plan for the go-live of the platform by 1 July 2025.

Blockers:

2. Resistance from customers who are not comfortable with digital onboarding.
3. Possible compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines.

Measures of Success:
1. Reduce the Turnaround Time (TAT) from 5 days to 2 hours.
2. Achieve an 80% reduction in manual data entry.
3. Maintain 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.

Assumptions:
1. Customers must have an Aadhaar-linked mobile number.
2. The system must support English and Hindi.
3. Loan disbursement will only be through verified bank accounts.
